justification: The CPT was used to measure impulsivity and inhibitory control by assessing participants' ability to inhibit responses to specific stimuli while maintaining vigilance.
The WOF task was administered to test propensity for risk-taking and gambling strategies, examining participants' choices between high-risk/high-reward and low-risk/low-reward options.
The EFR task was used to derive estimates of performance for recognizing negative emotion by evaluating accuracy and reaction time for facial expressions of disgust, anger, sadness, and fear.
The EFR task was used to measure positive emotional face recognition performance through reaction time and accuracy for happy facial expressions.
The TD task was used to test individual preference between small immediate rewards and larger delayed rewards, quantified by the area under the curve (AUC).
The Behavioral Inhibition System part of the BIS/BAS Scale provided a measure of appetitive and avoidant behavioral tendencies, particularly the inclination towards caution and inhibition.

The revised Drug Use Screening Inventory (DUSI-R) included a violence proneness metric (DUSI-VP) that estimated the risk of experiencing violence in early adulthood based on scores related to school and peer relations problems.
